In this tutorial you will see some basic advices about the correct sitting position in general.

 It consists of three parts:
 1. The right angle of sitting correctly on a chair
 2. Not to cross your legs
 3. To empty your back-pockets
 
 These advices will help you to optimize the way you are sitting and to avoid uneven load on your backbone.

To support your backbone properly, you have to sit in the right angle.

 This means you should sit straight in, put your feet parallel on the ground and push your chest out.

 Your backbone has to be S-shaped as highlighted in the picture.

To even the load on your back prevent crossing your legs.

 With your legs crossed, your backbone can not be in absolute balance. One side will always be more loaded than the other.

 To prevent this, you should place your feed always parallel on the ground.

Uneven load on your backbone can also be caused by wearing a purse in your back-pocket.\n\n This uneven load can - similar to crossing legs - cause serious backbone problems by relocating your weight on one side of your body.
Uneven load on the front\n\n You are not sitting in the right angle. Try to move more weight of your body to the rear of the chair.
Uneven load on the rear\n\n You are not sitting in the right angle. Try to move more weight of your body to the front of the chair.

Uneven load on the front left

 Try to sit in balance or are you crossing your legs?
 (right leg over your left leg)

Uneven load on the rear left

 Try to sit in balance or are you wearing purse?
 (in your left back-pocket)
Uneven load on the left\n\n You are not sitting in the right angle. Try to move more weight of your body to the right side of the chair.

Uneven load on the front right

 Try to sit in balance or are you crossing your legs?
